43114.name: Total wealth
43114.description: Total wealth is calculated by summing up each component of wealth (“bottom-up approach”): Natural capital + Produced capital + Human capital + Net foreign assets. Each of these components is calculated separately by the World Bank, usually as the net present value of future returns. Data on each wealth component - i.e. market exchange rates - comes from various sources.
43114.datasetName: Wealth per capita by component for various country groupings - World Bank (2017)

source.name: World Bank (2017)
source.dataPublisherSource: The World Bank used various sources to calculate wealth values, see each variable for more detail.
